qas.question: Which sub-Saharan African nation does the most trade with the US?
How much of the US's oil comes from Nigeria?
How much of the US's oil imports come from Nigeria?
How much growth did the IMF expect Nigeria's economy to have in 2009?

context: Nigeria was ranked <a0_0>30th in the world<a0_0/> in terms of GDP (PPP) in 2012. <a1_0>Nigeria<a1_0/> is the United States' largest trading partner in sub-Saharan Africa and supplies <a2_0>a fifth<a2_0/> of its oil (<a3_0>11%<a3_0/> of oil imports). It has the seventh-largest trade surplus with the US of any country worldwide. Nigeria is the 50th-largest export market for US goods and the 14th-largest exporter of goods to the US. The United States is the country's largest foreign investor. The International Monetary Fund (IMF) projected economic growth of 9% in 2008 and <a4_0>8.3%<a4_0/> in 2009. The IMF further projects an 8% growth in the Nigerian economy in 2011.
